definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
palm of the hand/sole of the foot/paw/horseshoe/to slap/to hold in one's hand/to wield
lit. arm-flinging shopkeeper/fig. sb who asks others to work but does nothing himself

sentences.english: Is palmar desquamate how to return a responsibility?
If he is interested in something, he may use his palm to prop the head.
sentences.chinese: 如果对某事感兴趣，就会用手掌支住头部。

sentences.english: The goalkeeper just managed to palm the ball over the crossbar.
sentences.chinese: 守门员用手掌勉强把球挡过球门横木。

sentences.english: His hand is so warm that make me quiet.
sentences.chinese: 祂得手掌是如此得温煖，使皒静下来。

sentences.english: Keeping you in my heart , together my hands putting.
sentences.chinese: 把你放在心上，合起了手掌。

sentences.english: The turquoise stones gleamed brightly against the pallor of his palm as he spread the ornament before her.
sentences.chinese: 蓝绿色的宝石在他苍白的手掌中熠熠发光。

sentences.english: Feel the little finger edge of your hand.
sentences.chinese: 摸一下你手掌的小指一侧。

sentences.english: Fine lines on the palm mean you think clearly and rationally.
sentences.chinese: 手掌纹路清晰的人，代表着思考清楚而理性。

sentences.english: The top of the line rhinestones are Swarovski Rhinestones.
sentences.chinese: 莱茵石线的顶端的手掌是施华洛世奇。

sentences.english: But he shall pour part of the oil into his own left hand.
sentences.chinese: 然后倒些油在自己左手掌中。

sentences.english: You have made my days a mere handbreadth; the span of my years is as nothing before you.
sentences.chinese: 你使我的年日，窄如手掌。

sentences.english: Xiao Suqin see xiao LAN hand injury, is love dearly.
sentences.chinese: 萧素琴看到萧岚手掌的伤，很是心疼。

sentences.english: He was utterly rigid except for his hands, which were opening and closing spasmodically.
sentences.chinese: 现在，他完全僵硬了，除了手掌时不时一开一合。

sentences.english: Kurt hit him, his flattened palm connecting with the underside of Tom's helmet.
sentences.chinese: 库尔特打击他，他伸平手掌拍在汤姆头盔的下面。

sentences.english: Palmtops are the smallest because they fit in the palm of your hand.
sentences.chinese: 掌上电脑是最小的，因为他们适合你的手掌里。

sentences.english: Her palms were excoriated by the hard labour of shoveling.
sentences.chinese: 她的手掌因繁重的挖土劳动而磨破了皮。

definition: palm (of one's hand)/control (extended meaning from having something in the palm of one's hand)
the five fingers of one's hand
